sections.instructions: Read carefully the instructions provided in the beginning of the document.

questions.questionText: __________ depicts what has actually happened.
If the value of Investment Multiplier is 5 and the increased income is ₹ 800 crore in an economy, then find the value of change in the investment in the economy.
Which of the following statements are true ?

statements.A: Quantitative tools control the extent of money supply by changing the CRR.
statements.B: There are two types of open market operations – outright and upright.
statements.C: A fall in the bank rate can decrease the money supply.
statements.D: Selling of a bond by RBI leads to reduction in quantity of reserves.
statements.E: The RBI can influence money supply by changing the rate at which it gives loan to the commercial banks.

questions.instruction: Choose the correct answer from the options given below :

questions.questionText: Paradox of Thrift means :
options: If all the people of the economy increase the proportion of income they save, the total value of investment in the economy will not increase, it will either decline or remain unchanged.
If all the people of the economy increase the proportion of income they spend, the total value of savings in the economy will not increase, it will either decline or remain unchanged.
If all the people of the economy decrease the proportion of income they save, the total value of savings in the economy will not increase, it will either decline or remain unchanged.
If all the people of the economy increase the proportion of income they save, the total value of savings in the economy will not increase, it will either decline or remain unchanged.

questions.questionText: Match List-I with List-II :

listII.I: Securities are pledged in order to repurchase
listII.II: Minimum rate at which funds are provided for long term
listII.III: Also known as Penal Interest Rate
listII.IV: Central Bank borrows funds from commerical banks

questions.instruction: Choose the correct answer from the options given below :

questions.questionText: Which of the following is not a function of Central Bank ?
options: It controls the money supply in the economy through different rates.
It acts as a banker to the government.
It accepts deposits and give loans to people.
It issues the currency of the country.

questions.questionText: Article 112 deals with :
All those elements which create liability and decrease the assets of government are known as :
Arrange the following elements in correct chronological sequence (earliest to latest) :
questions.instruction: Choose the correct answer from the options given below :

questions.questionText: Under flexible exchange rate, when the price of domestic currency in terms of foreign currency increases, it is called __________.
Match List-I with List-II :

listII.I: Setting up of IMF and World Bank

questions.instruction: Choose the correct answer from the options given below :

questions.questionText: Casualization of workforce would result in :
options: Decrease in the vulnerablility of the workforce.
Increase in the vulnerability of the workforce.
Increase in the number of regular workers.

questions.questionText: Choose the correct chronological sequence in ascending order (earliest to latest) :

elements.B: FRBMA (Fiscal Responsibility and Budget Management Act)

questions.questionText: __________ implies that resource extraction is not above the rate of regeneration of resources and the wastes generated are within the assimilating capacity of the environment.
Government of India enacted the Right to Education Act in 2009 to make free education a Fundamental Right of all children in the age group of __________ years.
Following are the sources of electricity generation in India. Arrange them in correct sequence on the basis of total power generation capacity (higher to lower) :
Arrange the following items in correct sequence :
The Great Leap Forward (GLF) campaign was initiated in __________.
Match List-I with List-II :

listII.II: Aimed at industralising the country on a massive scale
listII.III: Introduced the Great Proletarian Cultural Revolution
listII.IV: Seminal Report that explained sustainable development as meeting the basic needs of all for a better life

questions.questionText: Second phase of Green Revolution is termed from :
During 1980s, the growth rate in Pakistan improved on account of which of the following reasons ?
options: High amount of foreign direct investment inflow

questions.questionText: When there is unexpected rise in the sales __________
options: There will be unplanned accumulation of inventories.
There will be unplanned decumulation of inventories.

questions.questionText: During festive season, the currency deposit ratio __________.
European Monetary Union was created in __________.
Identify the correct statement in the context of Circular Flow of Income in a two sector economy :
options: Household receives factor services from firms.
Household supplies factor services to Government.

questions.questionText: Identify the correct set of statements.

statements.A: Ex Ante Saving represents what is actually planned to save.
statements.B: Ex Post Saving represents what is actually planned to save.
statements.C: Ex Post Saving depicts what has actually happened.
statements.D: Ex Ante Post Saving represents what is actually saved.

questions.instruction: Choose the correct answer from the options given below :

questions.questionText: Match List-I with List-II :

listII.I: Create liabilities or reduce financial assets
listII.IV: Create financial assets or reduce liabilities

questions.instruction: Choose the correct answer from the options given below :

questions.passage_reference: Passage starting with 'In many parts of India...'
questions.questionText: How is civic authority getting benefitted due to biocomposting ?
options: They have to dispose increased quantity of waste.
They don't have to dispose any waste.
Because civic authority has no role in waste management.
They have to dispose reduced quantity of waste.

questions.passage_reference: Passage starting with 'In many parts of India...'
questions.questionText: Choose the correct statement concerned with the passage :
options: Earthworm takes equal time to convert organic matter into compost with respect to normal composting process.
Earthworm takes more time to convert organic matter into compost with respect to normal composting process.
Earthworm takes less time to convert organic matter into compost with respect to normal composting process.
Comparison between earthworm based composting and normal composting cannot be made.

questions.passage_reference: Passage starting with 'In many parts of India...'
questions.questionText: Water bodies including ground water system have suffered due to :
options: Chemical contamination and increased demand for irrigation

questions.passage_reference: Passage starting with 'In many parts of India...'
questions.questionText: In certain parts of the country, cattle are maintained only because they __________.
options: Produce milk to increase income of farmers
Produce dung which is an important fertilizer and soil conditioner
Are a symbol of traditional ethics and values

questions.passage_reference: Passage starting with 'In many parts of India...'
questions.questionText: What should be the suitable title for the above passage?

questions.passage_reference: Passage starting with 'India's economy before the advent...'
questions.questionText: Before the British rule, India was well known for which manufacturing industries' products ?
options: Cotton and Silk or Khadi textiles
Cotton and Silk textiles, metal and precious stones, etc

questions.passage_reference: Passage starting with 'India's economy before the advent...'
questions.questionText: What kind of interests was the colonial government concerned with in the economic policy for Indian industries ?
options: To promote the handicraft industries of India
Promote and protect small scale industries of India
Protect and promote the economic interests of Indian industry along with their home country
Provide protection and promotion of the economic interests of their home country

questions.passage_reference: Passage starting with 'India's economy before the advent...'
questions.questionText: Choose the economists who estimated India's National Income and Per Capita Income.
options: Dadabhai Naoroji, William Digby, Bernier, V.K.R.V. Rao and R.C. Desai
Dadabhai Naoroji, William Digby, Findlay Shirras, V.K.R.V. Rao and R.C. Desai
Dadabhai Naoroji, Jagdish Bhagwati, V.K.R.V. Rao and R.C. Desai
Dadabhai Naoroji, Findlay Shrirras and V.K.R.V. Rao

questions.passage_reference: Passage starting with 'India's economy before the advent...'
questions.questionText: What was the country's growth of aggregate real output during the first half of the 20th century ?
options: The country's growth of aggregate real output was less than two percent coupled with a meagre one percent growth in per capita output per year.
The country's growth of aggregate real output was less than two percent coupled with a meagre one and a half percent growth in per capita output per year.
The country's growth of aggregate real output was less than two and a half percent coupled with a meagre half percent growth in per capita output per year.
The country's growth of aggregate real output was less than two percent coupled with a meagre half percent growth in per capita output per year.

questions.passage_reference: Passage starting with 'India's economy before the advent...'
questions.questionText: According to the passage, which of the following statement was true about Indian industries' products ?
options: Indian products were of inferior quality and cheap in the worldwide market.
Indian products were promoted by the colonial government and competed with other countries' markets also.
Indian products enjoyed a worldwide market based on quality of material used and the high standard of craftsmanship.
Indian products' raw material for primary goods was imported from the other countries and it helped to increase export.

questions.questionText: __________ is a market where economic agents can freely exchange their endowments with each other.
Which of the following are correct statements ?

statements.A: Marginal Utility is the change in Total Utility due to consumption of one additional unit of commodity.
statements.B: Two Indifference Curves intersect each other.
statements.C: Marginal Utility becomes Zero at a level when Total Utility remains constant.
statements.D: Diminishing Marginal Rate of Substitution does not affect Indifference Curve.
statements.E: Indifference Curve slopes downwards from left to right.

questions.instruction: Choose the correct answer from the options given below :

questions.questionText: Match List-I with List-II :

listII.I: Plans of all the consumers and firms in the market match
listII.II: Demand decreases with an increase in income
listII.III: Supply is greater than market demand
listII.IV: Imposition of upper limit by government

questions.instruction: Choose the correct answer from the options given below :

questions.questionText: When Elasticity of Demand Curve is 1 at every point on the Demand Curve, this curve is known as :
According to the Theory of Consumer Behaviour, Inequality p₁x1 + p2x2 ≤ M is called the Consumer's __________
Choose the correct statements from the following :

statements.A: Adam Smith is termed as Father of Modern Economics.
statements.B: J.M. Keynes gave the Theory of Income, Output and Employment.
statements.C: Four Sector Model = C + I + G + (X – M)
statements.D: Store of value is primary function of money.

questions.instruction: Choose the correct answer from the options given below :

questions.questionText: Rearrange the given statements in proper chronological sequence in an ascending order (earliest to latest) :

statements.A: General theory of Employment, Interest and Money by Keynes.
statements.B: Mahalanobis was made a fellow of Britain's Royal Society.
statements.C: An Inquiry into the Nature and Cause of the Wealth of Nations by Adam Smith.
statements.D: The Economic Consequences of the Peace by Keynes.

questions.instruction: Choose the correct answer from the options given below :

questions.questionText: If there is no government and no foreign trade, then :
The value of Nominal GDP is $ 1100 and the value of Real GDP is $ 1000. Find the value of GDP deflator.
Identify the correct statements :

statements.A: Stocks are defined over a period of time.
statements.B: Flows are defined over a period of time.
statements.C: Flows are defined at a particular point of time.
statements.D: Stocks are defined at a particular point of time.
statements.E: GVA at factor costs + Indirect Taxes – Subsidies = GVA at market prices.

questions.questionText: If the supply of final goods is assumed to be infinitely elastic at constant price over a short period of time, Aggregate output is determined solely by the value of Aggregate demand. This is called __________ Principle.
Nominal Interest Rate = __________
Value of MPS (Marginal Propensity to Save) is increased from 0.4 to 0.5. What would be the impact on Multiplier ?
options: The size of the multiplier would be increased.
The size of the multiplier would remain same.
Value of multiplier is undetermined with the given information.
The size of the multiplier would be decreased.
